So a few problems with your experiment,
1. Those spray bottles don't have anywhere close to the same amount of force as your normal breathing much less heavy breathing. This difference effects the penetrat8ng force through the material.
2. Most people wear cloth masks with much larger pores than medical grade paper masks. Porosity has a huge effect on diffusion especially when combined with higher pressures as noted in issue 1.
3. When those masks are saturated, they act like the diffusers on your water faucet decreasing the size of the water particles but increasing their spread.

Redo the experiment with saturated cloth masks and a shop vac to provide equivalent air pressure to human respiration as the force pushing the water through the mask. Then you'll have a valid experiment.
